description.narrative: More girls and boys, including the most marginalized in targeted areas benefit from improved quality of learning in an inclusive environment, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children have improved access to quality inclusive education, from early learning to secondary education, particularly those who are most marginalised

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More girls and boys, including the most marginalized in targeted areas benefit from improved quality of learning in an inclusive environment

description.narrative: UNICEF in Tajikistan developed and tested an integrated programme for in- and out of school adolescents to support acquisition of key competencies and skills relevant for their learning, development and transition to other levels of education, adulthood and employability. The competency-based education model is designed and is being delivered through formal and non-formal education, using referral pathways such as Student Councils in Centres for Additional Education proved itself to be scaled up. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

# of pre-service teacher training institutions across country introducing and instructing a course on inclusive child-focused pedagogy.
